Package lib.interfaces

Interface GraphADT<T>

All Known Subinterfaces:
NetworkADT<T>
All Known Implementing Classes:
CustomNetwork, Graph, Network
public interface GraphADT<T>

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void addEdge​(T vertex1, T vertex2)
    Adds an edge between two specified vertices in the graph.
    void addVertex​(T vertex)
    Adds a vertex to the graph.
    boolean isConnected()
    Checks if the entire graph is connected.
    boolean isEmpty()
    Checks if the graph is empty.
    java.util.Iterator<T> iteratorBFS​(T startVertex)
    Returns an iterator that performs a breadth-first search (BFS) starting from the specified vertex.
    java.util.Iterator iteratorDFS​(T startVertex)
    Returns an iterator that performs a depth-first search (DFS) starting from the specified vertex.
    java.util.Iterator iteratorShortestPath​(T startVertex, T targetVertex)
    Returns an iterator that provides the shortest path between two vertices in the graph.
    void removeEdge​(T vertex1, T vertex2)
    Removes an edge between two specified vertices in the graph.
    void removeVertex​(T vertex)
    Removes a specified vertex from the graph along with all edges associated with it.
    int size()
    Returns the number of vertices in the graph.
    java.lang.String toString()
    Returns a string representation of the graph.

  • Method Details

    • addVertex

      void addVertex​(T vertex)
      Adds a vertex to the graph.
      Parameters:
      vertex - the vertex to be added to the graph

    • removeVertex

      void removeVertex​(T vertex) throws ElementNotFoundException
      Removes a specified vertex from the graph along with all edges associated with it.
      Parameters:
      vertex - the vertex to be removed from the graph
      Throws:
      ElementNotFoundException - if the specified vertex cannot be found in the graph

    • addEdge

      void addEdge​(T vertex1, T vertex2)
      Adds an edge between two specified vertices in the graph.
      Parameters:
      vertex1 - the first vertex to be connected by the edge
      vertex2 - the second vertex to be connected by the edge

    • removeEdge

      void removeEdge​(T vertex1, T vertex2) throws ElementNotFoundException
      Removes an edge between two specified vertices in the graph. If the edge does not exist, an exception is thrown.
      Parameters:
      vertex1 - the first vertex connected by the edge to be removed
      vertex2 - the second vertex connected by the edge to be removed
      Throws:
      ElementNotFoundException - if either of the specified vertices cannot be found in the graph or if no edge exists between the vertices

    • iteratorBFS

      java.util.Iterator<T> iteratorBFS​(T startVertex) throws EmptyCollectionException
      Returns an iterator that performs a breadth-first search (BFS) starting from the specified vertex.
      Parameters:
      startVertex - the starting vertex for the BFS traversal
      Returns:
      an iterator for the BFS traversal of the graph
      Throws:
      EmptyCollectionException

    • iteratorDFS

      java.util.Iterator iteratorDFS​(T startVertex) throws EmptyCollectionException
      Returns an iterator that performs a depth-first search (DFS) starting from the specified vertex.
      Parameters:
      startVertex - the starting vertex for the DFS traversal
      Returns:
      an iterator for the DFS traversal of the graph
      Throws:
      EmptyCollectionException

    • iteratorShortestPath

      java.util.Iterator iteratorShortestPath​(T startVertex, T targetVertex) throws ElementNotFoundException
      Returns an iterator that provides the shortest path between two vertices in the graph.
      Parameters:
      startVertex - the starting vertex of the path
      targetVertex - the target vertex of the path
      Returns:
      an iterator for the shortest path from startVertex to targetVertex in the graph
      Throws:
      ElementNotFoundException

    • isEmpty

      boolean isEmpty()
      Checks if the graph is empty.
      Returns:
      true if the graph contains no vertices, false otherwise

    • isConnected

      boolean isConnected() throws EmptyCollectionException
      Checks if the entire graph is connected. A graph is considered connected if there is a path between any two vertices.
      Returns:
      true if the graph is connected, false otherwise
      Throws:
      EmptyCollectionException

    • size

      int size()
      Returns the number of vertices in the graph.
      Returns:
      the number of vertices in the graph

    • toString

      java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a string representation of the graph.
      Overrides:
      toString in class java.lang.Object
      Returns:
      a string description of the graph
